text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with the cuban sandwich that's
right as promised i'm gonna show you how
i go about putting together a Cubano
sandwich and i really don't do that many
sandwich videos since if you give your
average person on the street a list of
sandwich ingredients they could
generally figure out how to put it
together without a video but here we're
gonna make an exception because this
sandwich is so well exceptional and to
get started the first thing we'll do is
put together our secret sauce which is
going to be equal parts of mayonnaise
and yellow mustard no not Dijon all
right we're doing a Cubano not a Franco
but anyway we'll do equal parts
mayonnaise and mustard and then finish
that off with a little shake of cayenne
and then we'll go ahead and give that a
mix and that's it and then one sour
sauce which is really a spread has been
mixed up we will move on to the rest of
the ingredients okay so for this epic
sandwich we're also gonna need some
pickles which must be dill and
preferably hand sliced lengthwise we're
also going to need some sliced Swiss
cheese and please use something nice I
forget the name of this one but I
remember it was pretty fancy and then
we'll also need some thinly sliced ooh
preferably smoked ham as well as some
kind of roasted or pulled pork and where
are some chefs prefer thick slices of
the pork for me the sandwich is so much
better if we use torn up pieces like
this and while that gray meat might not
look impressive in the pan oh it used to
look impressive since we're using our
famous paper pork for this so that would
work beautifully as would our pulled
pork shoulder recipe or any one of our
carnitas recipes but you are going to
need some type of precooked and
hopefully succulent pork and then what
we'll do once we have all our fillings
pulled together is prep our bread which
in my case is a day-old loaf of Cuban
bread and what I like to do is trim off
both ends you don't have to but come on
the birds have to eat too and then we'll
split that in half since I think half a
loaf makes the perfect Cuban sandwich
size and then of course we'll have to
split that don't then taking our time
being careful to get it as even as we
can own another thing we're gonna go
over on the blog is whether it's better
to use fresh bread for this or Dale
Cuban bread it's a little controversial
but anyway once our bread is prepped we
will apply a generous amount of our
mustard mayonnaise spread to both sides
and please try to go all the way to
the edges only a psychopath would leave
part of the bread unspread and then once
a set will start building up our
sandwich starting with a couple slices
of cheese followed by a few slices of
ham and of course you will be
determining exactly how much you're
gonna put of everything since you are
after all the phyllis diller if out of
filler but that looks like a good amount
to me and then once our sandwich has
been whammed it's ready to be porked so
I'm gonna transfer over a very generous
portion of our broken up paper pork
which by the way must be heated up
before it's applied all right this
should be steaming hot except I'm always
scared to shoot steaming things plus
they always cool down as I'm moving the
camera around so while this doesn't look
very hot please pretend it is since that
is one of the keys here and then once
our pork shoulders been applied we'll go
ahead top that with our dill pickles
which as I mentioned have been hand
sliced lengthwise if you want to use
machine slice go ahead it just won't be
the same and then we will finish our
masterpiece off with two more slices of
cheese and we'll go ahead and press on
the top of our bread and that's it our
Cuban sandwich is ready to grill which
I'm gonna do in this nice heavy
cast-iron pan and we will toast this
over medium heat in just a little bit of
melted butter although you know what we
probably should have used a little lard
next time and once that's placed in what
we'll need to do is press it down
somehow which I'm just going to do with
another pan but anything flat and heavy
will work including things like bricks
wrapped in foil and all we're gonna do
here is toast that for three or four
minutes per side until that bread is
nice and crisp in browned and everything
is heated through which by the way is
why it's so important your pork is hot
okay if you fill this with cold pork by
the time that got heated through your
bread would be burnt and of course if
you have one of those panini presses
this sandwich is exactly what those
things were made for so before you do
this in a pan check your garage in your
closets in your cabinets you may have
one stuck in the back you forgot about
but anyway we're gonna go ahead and
toast that in butter or lard over medium
until we think it's perfect which point
we can cut that in half and eat it and
because people complained I didn't
scrape the crust in the Cuban bread
video let's have a little listen to the
crispiness before we cut
oh yeah
the sound of success so we will go ahead
and cut that in half and while
admittedly this is not the most colorful
or visually beautiful sandwich it makes
up for that in literally every other way
so I went ahead and serve that up with
some taro chips plantain would have made
more sense but anyway we will serve that
up with the chips of our choice
and while this may appear to be nothing
more than a hot cheesy meat bomb it's
actually not super heavy and very very
well balanced yes we do have a lot of
richness from the cheese and the ham and
that succulent pork but all that is
balanced very nicely with the tangy
nests of our mustard sauce and our
pickles with everything being in case so
wonderfully in that crispy hot bread so
just an absolutely stellar combination
of tastes and textures and I could have
easily gone on for another five minutes
talking about how good this was but I
decided to stop filming and eat the rest
which turned out to be a great call but
anyway that's it my take on the Cuban
sandwich I really do hope you bake off a
couple loaves of this amazing bread and
then give this incredible sandwich a try
very soon so head over to food wishes
calm for all the ingredient amounts and
more info as usual and as always enjoy
[Music]
